lines.text: Why waste those cute little tricks that the Army taught us just because it's sort of peaceful now.

[Answering the phone]
Hello, this is a recording, you've dialed the right number, now hang up and don't do it again.
I can't do it, boys. I've got my wife to think of.
Think of her rich.
Think of me dead.
I've got great news for you.
Auburn beat Alabama by twelve points.
that's danger. Cliffhanging. You could never love a woman like you love danger.

[speaking of her son]
He met a jiggly little number who was Vegas-bound.
"Jiggly little number" isn't exactly how I would describe Danny Ocean... more like a well-mannered shark.
Is he?
never to answer the 'phone in December.
That's crazy. Why?
Because one December, every time I picked up the 'phone they sent me out into the snow to play with my friends. That was at the Bulge.
Look Vince - the brave ones don't come home. You stay scared.
Yeah. You were always one of those guys who didn't want any brave ones on patrol with you, weren't you?
It's simple enough - in my book "brave" rhymes with "stupid", and it still does.
It's not a zircon, it's a diamond; a big diamond. You don't think it's too big, do you? Your mother has excellent taste.

[Sarcastically]
Has she?
You'll miss my wedding!
Mother, I have never missed one of your weddings.
Yes, you did. My first one.

[to Jimmy as he is getting a massage from a beautiful masseuse]
If you're not careful, buddy boy, she'll rub you out.
You're not gonna make yourself popular, knocking Danny.
Who's knocking him? I love him. I respect talent. All I'm asking is he should me a little.
Too tough. Don' ask.
the eleven of us cats against this one city...?

[to Sam Harmon]
I'll consider mistress, plaything, toy for a night, but I refuse to be your mother. That's out!
Going down.
Going down.
Where they serve the drinks.
To the bar.

[speaking on the 'phone]
Speaking of finances. Could you let me have some more.
More? More what?
Money. M-O-N-Y.
M-O-N-*E*-Y
The odds are always with the house,
[slams hand on pool table]
with the house!
Well I married you once and it didn't work out too well, so what's wrong with a little hey-hey?
Nothing. Nothing at all. I'd never knock it as long as there was a little love involved.
You mean there isn't.
On your part, not much.

[to Danny and Sam]
I know you won't try anything cute. Fifty percent of something is better than one hundred percent of nothin'.

[to Sam about her marriage with Danny]
We didn't have a home, Sam. We had a floating crap game.

[Obviously very tipsy]
I thought he said i was a lady's drink. I think he meant a lady horse.
Honey Face, I'd like to wrap you up, take you home, and spread you on my waffle!
If it's so fool-proof, why hasn't somebody done it yet?
Same reason nobody's gone to the moon yet - no equipment.
And we're equipped.

[to Danny Oceans]
Oh, Danny. What a prize you are. The only husband in the world who'd proposition his own wife.
I'm so drunk, I don't think I could lie down without holding on!
Happy burial, dead dog.

[Josh starts chuckling]
What's so funny?
I knew this color would come in handy one day.
Hey, Josh...
Yeah?
How do you get this stuff off?
Well, I usually-
[stops midsentence, then laughs sarcastically]
